MAST.ingredients.checker.vaspchecker module¶

class MAST.ingredients.checker.vaspchecker.VaspChecker(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: MAST.ingredients.checker.basechecker.BaseChecker

VASP checker functions

add_selective_dynamics_to_structure_file(sdarray)[source]¶

Add selective dynamics to a structure file. In the case of VASP, the structure file is POSCAR-like Args:

sdarray <numpy array of bool>: Numpy array of
booleans for T F F etc.
combine_displacement_files(mydir='')[source]¶

Combine displacement files (here XDATCARs) into one file. Args:

mydir <str>: top directory for DYNMAT files.
Use ingredient directory if null.
combine_dynamical_matrix_files(mydir='')[source]¶

Combine dynamical matrix files into one file. The subfiles should be in subfolders under the top directory. Args:

mydir <str>: top directory for DYNMAT files.
Use ingredient directory if null.
Returns:
Creates a single DYNMAT file
forward_charge_density_file(childpath)[source]¶

Copy the charge density file to the child folder. For VASP, this is the CHGCAR. Args:

childpath <str>: path to child ingredient
forward_displacement_file(childpath, newname='XDATCAR')[source]¶

Forward displacement information. For VASP, this is the XDATCAR file. Args:

childpath <str>: Path of child ingredient newname <str>: new name (default ‘XDATCAR’)
forward_dynamical_matrix_file(childpath, newname='DYNMAT')[source]¶

Forward the dynamical matrix. For VASP, this is the DYNMAT file. Args:

childpath <str>: Path of child ingredient newname <str>: new name (default ‘DYNMAT’)
forward_energy_file(childpath, newname='OSZICAR')[source]¶

Forward the energy file. For VASP, this is the OSZICAR file. Args:

childpath <str>: Path of child ingredient newname <str>: new name (default ‘OSZICAR’)
forward_extra_restart_files(childpath)[source]¶

Forward extra restart files: For VASP, this entails a softlink to WAVECAR and CHGCAR. Args:

childpath <str>: path to child ingredient
forward_final_structure_file(childpath, newname='POSCAR')[source]¶

Forward the final structure. For VASP, this is the CONTCAR. Args:

childpath <str>: Path of child ingredient newname <str>: new name (default ‘POSCAR’)
forward_initial_structure_file(childpath, newname='POSCAR')[source]¶

Forward the initial structure. For VASP, this is the POSCAR. This function is used after phonon calculations, where the CONTCAR contains the last displacement. To forward to PHON, the POSCAR (without displacements) should be used. Args:

childpath <str>: Path of child ingredient newname <str>: new name (default ‘POSCAR’)
forward_wavefunction_file(childpath)[source]¶

Copy the wavefunction file to the child folder. For VASP, this is the WAVECAR. CHGCAR. Args:

childpath <str>: path to child ingredient
get_energy()[source]¶

Get the energy. For VASP, this is E0 energy from vasprun.xml

get_energy_from_energy_file()[source]¶

Get the energy from the energy file. For VASP, this is the last E0 energy from OSZICAR, and this function should be used if vasprun.xml is corrupted or not available. Args:

mydir <str>: Directory in which to look.
Returns:
<float>: last E0 energy from OSZICAR
get_final_structure_from_directory(mydir='')[source]¶

Get the final structure. For VASP, this is the CONTCAR file. Args:

mydir <str>: Directory. If no directory is given,
use current ingredient directory given as keyword ‘name’
get_initial_structure_from_directory(mydir='')[source]¶

Get the initial structure. For VASP, this is the POSCAR file. Args:

mydir <str>: Directory. If no directory is given,
use current ingredient directory given as keyword ‘name’
get_structure_from_file(myfilepath='')[source]¶

Get the structure from a specified file path. For VASP, this is a POSCAR-type file. Args:

myfilepath <str>: File path for structure.
get_total_electrons(myposcar, mypotcar)[source]¶

Get the total number of considered electrons in the system.

get_valence_list(mypotcar)[source]¶

Get list of number of valence electrons for species. For VASP, this is a list of zvals from POTCAR. Args:

mypotcar <list of PotcarSingle objects>
Returns:
zval_list <list of int>: List of number of
valence electrons
has_ending_structure_file()[source]¶

Evaluate whether the ingredient has a starting structure file. For VASP, this is a CONTCAR.

has_starting_structure_file()[source]¶

Evaluate whether the ingredient has a starting structure file. For VASP, this is a POSCAR.

is_complete()[source]¶

Check if single VASP non-NEB calculation is complete.

is_ready_to_run()[source]¶

Check if single VASP non-NEB ingredient is ready to run.

is_started()[source]¶

See if the ingredient has been started on the queue.

make_hessian(myposcar, mydir)[source]¶

Combine DYNMATs into one hessian and solve for frequencies. myposcar = Poscar mydir = top directory for DYNMAT files

read_my_displacement_file(mydir='', fname='XDATCAR')[source]¶

Read a displacement file. For VASP this is XDATCAR. Args:

mydir <str>: Directory. Use ingredient directory
if null.
fname <str>: Filename to read. Default is
XDATCAR
Returns:
xdatdict <dict>: Dictionary of configurations

xdatdict[‘descline’] = <str> description line xdatdict[‘specline’] = <str> species line xdatdict[‘numline’] = <str> numbers lines xdatdict[‘type’] = <str> Direct or not xdatdict[‘numatoms’] = <int> number of atoms xdatdict[‘configs’][config <int>] = <list>

list of lines in this configuration

xdatdict[‘scale’] = <str> scale xdatdict[‘latta’] = <str> lattice vector a xdatdict[‘lattb’] = <str> lattice vector b xdatdict[‘lattc’] = <str> lattice vector c

read_my_dynamical_matrix_file(mydir='', fname='DYNMAT')[source]¶

Read a dynamical matrix file. For VASP this is DYNMAT. Args:

mydir <str>: directory; use ingredient directory
if null is given

fname <str>: file name (default ‘DYNMAT’)

Returns:
dyndict <dict>: dictionary structured like this:

[‘numspec’] = <int> number of species [‘numatoms’] = <int> number of atoms [‘numdisp’] = <int> number of displacements [‘massline’] = <str> masses line [‘atoms’][atom <int>][disp <int>][‘displine’] =

displacement vector (part of first line in dynmat block, e.g. “0.01 0 0”)
[‘atoms’][atom <int>][disp <int>][‘dynmat’] =
<list> list of dynmat lines for this atom and this displacement
scale_mesh(newstr, density)[source]¶

Scale the kpoint mesh. Args:

newstr <structure>: new structure density <float>: kpoint density
Returns:
newkmesh <pymatgen Kpoints>: new kpoint mesh sets program_keys ‘mast_kpoints’ to new mesh
set_up_program_input()[source]¶

Set up the program input files.

softlink_charge_density_file(childpath)[source]¶

Softlink the parent charge density file to the child folder For VASP, this entails a softlink to CHGCAR Args:

childpath <str>: path to child ingredient
softlink_wavefunction_file(childpath)[source]¶

Softlink the parent wavefunction file to the child folder For VASP, this entails a softlink to WAVECAR. Args:

childpath <str>: path to child ingredient
write_final_structure_file(mystruc)[source]¶

Write the final structure to a file. For VASP, this is CONTCAR.

write_my_displacement_file(xdatdict, mydir='', fname='XDATCAR')[source]¶

Write a displacement file. Args:

xdatdict <dict>: Dictionary of XDATCAR (see read_my_xdatcar) mydir <str>: Directory in which to write.

Use ingredient directory if null.

fname <str>: filename (default DYNMAT)

write_my_dynamical_matrix_file(dyndict, mydir='', fname='DYNMAT')[source]¶

Write a dynamical matrix file based on a dictionary. Args:

dyndict <dict>: Dictionary of dynmat (see read_my_dynmat) mydir <str>: Directory in which to write;

use ingredient directory if null

fname <str>: filename (default DYNMAT)

write_my_dynmat_without_disp_or_mass(dyndict, mydir='', fname='DYNMAT')[source]¶

Write a dynamical matrix file without the displacement indicators 1, 2, 3 and without the masses line, and with first line having only the total number of displacements, for PHON. Args:

dyndict <dict>: Dictionary of dynmat (see read_my_dynmat) mydir <str>: Directory in which to write; use

ingredient directory if null

fname <str>: filename (default DYNMAT)
